metadata.Title: CVE-2019-13312 on Ubuntu 20.04 FIPS Compliant (focal) - medium.
metadata.Description:
block_cmp() in libavcodec/zmbvenc.c in FFmpeg 4.1.3 has a heap-based buffer over-read.

Update Instructions:

Run `sudo pro fix CVE-2019-13312` to fix the vulnerability. The problem can be corrected
by updating your system to the following package versions:

ffmpeg - 7:4.2.4-1ubuntu0.1
libavcodec-extra - 7:4.2.4-1ubuntu0.1
libavcodec-extra58 - 7:4.2.4-1ubuntu0.1
libavcodec58 - 7:4.2.4-1ubuntu0.1
libavdevice58 - 7:4.2.4-1ubuntu0.1
libavfilter-extra - 7:4.2.4-1ubuntu0.1
libavfilter-extra7 - 7:4.2.4-1ubuntu0.1
libavfilter7 - 7:4.2.4-1ubuntu0.1
libavformat58 - 7:4.2.4-1ubuntu0.1
libavresample4 - 7:4.2.4-1ubuntu0.1
libavutil56 - 7:4.2.4-1ubuntu0.1
libpostproc55 - 7:4.2.4-1ubuntu0.1
libswresample3 - 7:4.2.4-1ubuntu0.1
libswscale5 - 7:4.2.4-1ubuntu0.1
No subscription required

notes.Note: msalvatore> "The buffer overflow is a regression since http://git.videolan.org/?p=ffmpeg.git;a=commitdiff;h=0321370601833f4ae47e8e11c44570ea4bd382a4"

criterions.comment: ffmpeg package in focal was vulnerable but has been fixed (note: '7:4.2.4-1ubuntu0.1').
